00002 ###########
00003 #use Carp;
00004 
00005 =head1 NAME
00006 
00007         Matrix macros for the PG language
00008 
00009 =head1 SYNPOSIS
00010 
00011 
00012 
00013 =head1 DESCRIPTION
00014 
00015 Almost all of the macros in the file are very rough at best.  The most useful is display_matrix.
00016 Many of the other macros work with vectors and matrices stored as anonymous arrays. 
00017 
00018 Frequently it may be
00019 more useful to use the Matrix objects defined RealMatrix.pm and Matrix.pm and the constructs listed there.
00020 
00021 
00022 =cut
00023

00025         be_strict();
00026 }

00029 }

00031 # this subroutine zero_check is not very well designed below -- if it is used much it should receive
00032 # more work -- particularly for checking relative tolerance.  More work needs to be done if this is 
00033 # actually used.
00034 
00035 sub zero_check{
00036     my $array = shift;
00037     my %options = @_;
00038         my $num = @$array;
00039         my $i;
00040         my $max = 0; my $mm;
00041         for ($i=0; $i< $num; $i++) {
00042                 $mm = $array->[$i] ;
00043                 $max = abs($mm) if abs($mm) > $max;
00044         }
00045     my $tol = $options{tol};
00046     $tol = 0.01*$options{reltol}*$options{avg} if defined($options{reltol}) and defined $options{avg};
00047     $tol = .000001 unless defined($tol);
00048         ($max <$tol) ? 1: 0;       # 1 if the array is close to zero;
00049 }
00050 sub vec_dot{
00051         my $vec1 = shift;
00052         my $vec2 = shift;
00053         warn "vectors must have the same length" unless @$vec1 == @$vec2;  # the vectors must have the same length.
00054         my @vec1=@$vec1;
00055         my @vec2=@$vec2;
00056         my $sum = 0;
00057 
00058         while(@vec1) {
00059                 $sum += shift(@vec1)*shift(@vec2);
00060         }
00061         $sum;
00062 }
00063 sub proj_vec {
00064         my $vec = shift;
00065         warn "First input must be a column matrix" unless ref($vec) eq 'Matrix' and ${$vec->dim()}[1] == 1; 
00066         my $matrix = shift;    # the matrix represents a set of vectors spanning the linear space 
00067                                # onto which we want to project the vector.
00068         warn "Second input must be a matrix" unless ref($matrix) eq 'Matrix' and ${$matrix->dim()}[1] == ${$vec->dim()}[0];
00069         $matrix * transpose($matrix) * $vec;
00070 }
00071                 
00072 sub vec_cmp{    #check to see that the submitted vector is a non-zero multiple of the correct vector
00073     my $correct_vector = shift;
00074     my %options = @_;
00075         my $ans_eval = sub {
00076                 my $in =  shift @_;
00077                 
00078                 my $ans_hash = new AnswerHash;
00079                 my @in = split("\0",$in);
00080                 my @correct_vector=@$correct_vector;                
00081                 $ans_hash->{student_ans} = "( " . join(", ", @in ) . " )";
00082                 $ans_hash->{correct_ans} = "( " . join(", ", @correct_vector ) . " )";
00083 
00084                 return($ans_hash) unless @$correct_vector == @in;  # make sure the vectors are the same dimension
00085                 
00086                 my $correct_length = vec_dot($correct_vector,$correct_vector);
00087                 my $in_length = vec_dot(\@in,\@in);
00088                 return($ans_hash) if $in_length == 0; 
00089 
00090                 if (defined($correct_length) and $correct_length != 0) {
00091                         my $constant = vec_dot($correct_vector,\@in)/$correct_length;
00092                         my @difference = ();
00093                         for(my $i=0; $i < @correct_vector; $i++ ) {
00094                                 $difference[$i]=$constant*$correct_vector[$i] - $in[$i];
00095                         }
00096                         $ans_hash->{score} = zero_check(\@difference);
00097                         
00098                 } else {
00099                         $ans_hash->{score} = 1 if vec_dot(\@in,\@in) == 0;
00100                 }
00101                 $ans_hash;
00102                 
00103     };
00104     
00105     $ans_eval;
00106 }

00108 ############
00109 
00110 =head4  display_matrix
00111 
00112                 Usage          \{ display_matrix( [ [1, '\(\sin x\)'], [ans_rule(5), 6] ]) \}
00113             \{ display_matrix($A, align=>'crvl') \}
00114                   \[ \{   display_matrix_mm($A)  \} \]
00115                         \[ \{ display_matrix_mm([ [1, 3], [4, 6] ])  \} \]
00116 
00117     display_matrix produces a matrix for display purposes.  It checks whether
00118           it is producing LaTeX output, or if it is displaying on a web page in one
00119           of the various modes.  The input can either be of type Matrix, or a
00120           reference to an array.
00121 
00122           Entries can be numbers, Fraction objects, bits of math mode, or answer
00123     boxes.  An entire row can be replaced by the string 'hline' to produce
00124     a horizontal line in the matrix.
00125 
00126           display_matrix_mm functions similarly, except that it should be inside
00127           math mode.  display_matrix_mm cannot contain answer boxes in its entries.
00128           Entries to display_matrix_mm should assume that they are already in
00129           math mode.
00130 
00131           Both functions take an optional alignment string, similar to ones in
00132           LaTeX tabulars and arrays.  Here c for centered columns, l for left
00133           flushed columns, and r for right flushed columns.
00134 
00135           The alignment string can also specify vertical rules to be placed in the
00136           matrix.  Here s or | denote a solid line, d is a dashed line, and v
00137           requests the default vertical line.  This can be set on a system-wide
00138           or course-wide basis via the variable $defaultDisplayMatrixStyle, and
00139           it can default to solid, dashed, or no vertical line (n for none).
00140 
00141           The matrix has left and right delimiters also specified by
00142           $defaultDisplayMatrixStyle.  They can be parentheses, square brackets,
00143         braces, vertical bars, or none.  The default can be overridden in
00144           an individual problem with optional arguments such as left=>"|", or
00145           right=>"]".
00146 
00147     You can specify an optional argument of 'top_labels'=> ['a', 'b', 'c'].
00148     These are placed above the columns of the matrix (as is typical for
00149     linear programming tableau, for example).  The entries will be typeset
00150     in math mode.
00151 
00152     Top labels require a bit of care.  For image modes, they look better
00153     with display_matrix_mm where it is all one big image, but they work with
00154     display_matrix.  With tth, you pretty much have to use display_matrix
00155     since tth can't handle the TeX tricks used to get the column headers
00156     up there if it gets the whole matrix at once.
00157 
00158 
00159 =cut
00160

00162 sub display_matrix_mm{    # will display a matrix in tex format.  
00163                        # the matrix can be either of type array or type 'Matrix'
00164         return display_matrix(@_, 'force_tex'=>1);
00165 }
00166 
00167 sub display_matrix_math_mode {
00168         return display_matrix_mm(@_);
00169 }
00170 
00171 sub display_matrix {
00172         my $ra_matrix = shift;
00173         my %opts = @_;
00174         my $styleParams = defined($main::defaultDisplayMatrixStyle) ?
00175                 $main::defaultDisplayMatrixStyle : "(s)";
00176         
00177         set_default_options(\%opts,
00178                 '_filter_name' => 'display_matrix',
00179                 'force_tex' => 0,
00180                 'left' => substr($styleParams,0,1),
00181                 'right' => substr($styleParams,2,1),
00182                 'midrule' => substr($styleParams,1,1),
00183                 'top_labels' => 0,
00184                 'box'=>[-1,-1], # pair location of boxed element
00185                 'allow_unknown_options'=> 1,
00186                 'num_format' => "%.0f",
00187         );
00188         
00189         my ($numRows, $numCols, @myRows);
00190 
00191         if (ref($ra_matrix) eq 'Matrix' )  {
00192                 ($numRows, $numCols) = $ra_matrix->dim();
00193                 for( my $i=0; $i<$numRows; $i++) {
00194                         $myRows[$i] = [];
00195                         for (my $j=0; $j<$numCols; $j++) {
00196                                 my $entry = $ra_matrix->element($i+1,$j+1);
00197                                 $entry = "#" unless defined($entry);
00198                                 push @{ $myRows[$i] },  $entry;
00199                         }
00200                 }
00201         } else { # matrix is input as [ [1,2,3],[4,5,6]]
00202                 $numCols = 0;
00203                 @myRows = @{$ra_matrix};
00204                 $numRows = scalar(@myRows); # counts horizontal rules too
00205                 my $tmp;
00206                 for $tmp (@myRows) {
00207                         if($tmp ne 'hline') {
00208                                 my @arow = @{$tmp};
00209                                 $numCols= scalar(@arow);   #number of columns in table
00210                                 last;
00211                         }
00212                 }
00213         }
00214         
00215         my $out;
00216         my $j;
00217         my $alignString=''; # alignment as a string for dvi/pdf
00218         my $alignList;      # alignment as a list
00219 
00220         if(defined($opts{'align'})) {
00221                 $alignString= $opts{'align'};
00222                 $alignString =~ s/v/$opts{'midrule'}/g;
00223                 $alignString =~ tr/s/|/; # Treat "s" as "|"
00224                 $alignString =~ tr/n//;  # Remove "n" altogether
00225                 @$alignList = split //, $alignString;
00226         } else {
00227                 for($j=0; $j<$numCols; $j++) {
00228                         $alignList->[$j] = "c";
00229                         $alignString .= "c";
00230                 }
00231         }
00232         # Before we start, we cannot let top_labels proceed if we
00233         # are in tth mode and force_tex is true since tth can't handle
00234         # the resulting code
00235         if($opts{'force_tex'} and $main::displayMode eq 'HTML_tth') {
00236                 $opts{'top_labels'} = 0;
00237         }
00238 
00239         $out .= dm_begin_matrix($alignString, %opts);
00240         # column labels for linear programming
00241         $out .= dm_special_tops(%opts, 'alignList'=>$alignList) if ($opts{'top_labels'});
00242         $out .= dm_mat_left($numRows, %opts);
00243     my $cnt = 1; # we count rows in in case an element is boxed
00244         # vertical lines put in with first row
00245         $j = shift @myRows;
00246         $out .= dm_mat_row($j, $alignList, %opts, 'isfirst'=>$numRows, 
00247         'cnt' => $cnt);
00248     $cnt++ unless ($j eq 'hline');
00249         $out .= dm_mat_right($numRows, %opts);
00250         for $j (@myRows) {
00251                 $out .= dm_mat_row($j, $alignList, %opts, 'isfirst'=>0,
00252         'cnt' => $cnt);
00253         $cnt++ unless ($j eq 'hline');
00254         }
00255         $out .= dm_end_matrix(%opts);
00256         $out;
00257 }
00258 
00259 sub dm_begin_matrix {
00260         my ($aligns)=shift;   #alignments of columns in table
00261         my %opts = @_;
00262         my $out =        "";
00263         if ($main::displayMode eq 'TeX' or $opts{'force_tex'}) {
00264                 # This should be doable by regexp, but it wasn't working for me
00265                 my ($j, @tmp);
00266                 @tmp = split //, $aligns;
00267                 $aligns='';
00268                 for $j (@tmp) {
00269                         # I still can't get an @ expression sent to TeX, so plain
00270                         # vertical line
00271                         $aligns .= ($j eq "d") ? '|' : $j;
00272                 }
00273                 $out .= $opts{'force_tex'} ? '' : '\(';
00274                 if($opts{'top_labels'}) {
00275                         $out .= '\begingroup\setbox3=\hbox{\ensuremath{';
00276                 }
00277                 $out .= '\displaystyle\left'.$opts{'left'}."\\begin{array}{$aligns} \n";
00278         }        elsif ($main::displayMode eq 'Latex2HTML') {
00279                 $out .= "\n\\begin{rawhtml} <TABLE  BORDER=0>\n\\end{rawhtml}";
00280         }        elsif ( $main::displayMode eq 'HTML_MathJax'
00281                       or $main::displayMode eq 'HTML_dpng'
00282                       or $main::displayMode eq 'HTML_tth'
00283                       or $main::displayMode eq 'HTML_jsMath'
00284                       or $main::displayMode eq 'HTML_asciimath'
00285                       or $main::displayMode eq 'HTML_LaTeXMathML'
00286                       or $main::displayMode eq 'HTML'
00287                       or $main::displayMode eq 'HTML_img') {
00288                 $out .= qq!<TABLE BORDER="0" Cellspacing="8">\n!;
00289         }
00290         else { 
00291                 $out = "Error: dm_begin_matrix: Unknown displayMode: $main::displayMode.\n";
00292                 }
00293         $out;
00294 }
00295 
00296 sub dm_special_tops {
00297         my %opts = @_;
00298         my @top_labels = @{$opts{'top_labels'}};
00299         my $out = '';
00300     my @alignList = @{$opts{'alignList'}};
00301         my ($j, $k);
00302         my ($brh, $erh) = ("",""); # Start and end raw html
00303         if($main::displayMode eq 'Latex2HTML') {
00304                 $brh = "\\begin{rawhtml}";
00305                 $erh = "\\end{rawhtml}";
00306         }
00307         
00308         if ($main::displayMode eq 'TeX' or $opts{'force_tex'}) {
00309                 for $j (@top_labels) {
00310                         $out .= '\smash{\raisebox{2.9ex}{\ensuremath{'.
00311                                 $j . '}}} &';
00312                 }
00313                 chop($out); # remove last &
00314                 $out .= '\cr\noalign{\vskip -2.5ex}'."\n"; # want skip jump up 2.5ex
00315         } elsif ( $main::displayMode eq 'HTML_MathJax'
00316                       or $main::displayMode eq 'HTML_dpng'
00317                       or $main::displayMode eq 'HTML_tth'
00318                       or $main::displayMode eq 'HTML_jsMath'
00319                       or $main::displayMode eq 'HTML_asciimath'
00320                       or $main::displayMode eq 'HTML_LaTeXMathML'
00321                       or $main::displayMode eq 'HTML'
00322                       or $main::displayMode eq 'HTML_img') {
00323                 $out .= "$brh<tr><td>$erh"; # Skip a column for the left brace
00324                 for $j (@top_labels) {
00325             $k = shift @alignList;
00326             while(defined($k) and ($k !~ /[lrc]/)) {
00327                 $out .= "$brh<td></td>$erh";
00328                 $k = shift @alignList;
00329             }
00330                         $out .= "$brh<td align=\"center\">$erh". ' \('.$j.'\)'."$brh</td>$erh";
00331                 }
00332         $out .= "<td></td>";
00333         } else {
00334                 $out = "Error: dm_begin_matrix: Unknown displayMode: $main::displayMode.\n";
00335         }
00336         return $out;
00337 }
00338 
00339 sub dm_mat_left {
00340         my $numrows = shift;
00341         my %opts = @_;
00342         if ($main::displayMode eq 'TeX' or $opts{'force_tex'}) {
00343                 return ""; # left delim is built into begin matrix
00344         }
00345         my $out='';
00346         my $j;
00347         my ($brh, $erh) = ("",""); # Start and end raw html
00348         if($main::displayMode eq 'Latex2HTML') {
00349                 $brh = "\\begin{rawhtml}";
00350                 $erh = "\\end{rawhtml}";
00351         }
00352 
00353         if( $main::displayMode eq 'HTML_MathJax'
00354                       or $main::displayMode eq 'HTML_dpng'
00355                       or $main::displayMode eq 'HTML_tth'
00356                       or $main::displayMode eq 'HTML_jsMath'
00357                       or $main::displayMode eq 'HTML_asciimath'
00358                       or $main::displayMode eq 'HTML_LaTeXMathML'
00359                       or $main::displayMode eq 'HTML'
00360                       or $main::displayMode eq 'HTML_img') {
00361                 $out .= "$brh<tr valign=\"center\"><td nowrap=\"nowrap\" align=\"left\" rowspan=\"$numrows\">$erh";
00362                 $out .= dm_image_delimeter($numrows, $opts{'left'});
00363 #               $out .= "$brh<td><table border=0  cellspacing=5>\n$erh";
00364                 return $out;
00365         }
00366         # Mode is now tth
00367 
00368         $out .= "<tr valign=\"center\"><td nowrap=\"nowrap\" align=\"left\" rowspan=\"$numrows\">";
00369         $out .= dm_tth_delimeter($numrows, $opts{'left'});
00370 #       $out .= "<td><table border=0  cellspacing=5>\n";
00371         return $out;
00372 }

00374 sub dm_mat_right {
00375         my $numrows = shift;
00376         my %opts = @_;
00377         my $out='';
00378         my $j;
00379         my ($brh, $erh) = ("",""); # Start and end raw html
00380         if($main::displayMode eq 'Latex2HTML') {
00381                 $brh = "\\begin{rawhtml}";
00382                 $erh = "\\end{rawhtml}";
00383         }
00384 
00385         
00386         if ($main::displayMode eq 'TeX' or $opts{'force_tex'}) {
00387                 return "";
00388         }
00389 
00390         if( $main::displayMode eq 'HTML_MathJax'
00391                       or $main::displayMode eq 'HTML_dpng'
00392                       or $main::displayMode eq 'HTML_tth'
00393                       or $main::displayMode eq 'HTML_jsMath'
00394                       or $main::displayMode eq 'HTML_asciimath'
00395                       or $main::displayMode eq 'HTML_LaTeXMathML'
00396                       or $main::displayMode eq 'HTML'
00397                       or $main::displayMode eq 'HTML_img') {
00398                 $out .= "$brh<td nowrap=\"nowrap\" align=\"right\" rowspan=\"$numrows\">$erh";
00399                 
00400                 $out.= dm_image_delimeter($numrows, $opts{'right'});
00401                 return $out;
00402         }
00403 
00404 #       $out .= "</table>";
00405   $out .= '<td nowrap="nowrap" align="left" rowspan="'.$numrows.'2">';
00406         $out .= dm_tth_delimeter($numrows, $opts{'right'});
00407   $out .= '</td>';
00408         return $out;
00409 }

00411 sub dm_end_matrix {
00412         my %opts = @_;
00413         
00414         my $out = "";
00415         if ($main::displayMode eq 'TeX' or $opts{'force_tex'}) {
00416                 $out .= "\\end{array}\\right$opts{right}";
00417                 if($opts{'top_labels'}) {
00418                         $out .= '}} \dimen3=\ht3 \advance\dimen3 by 3ex \ht3=\dimen3'."\n".
00419                         '\box3\endgroup';
00420                 }
00421                 $out .= $opts{'force_tex'} ? '' : "\\) ";
00422         }
00423         elsif ($main::displayMode eq 'Latex2HTML') {
00424                 $out .= "\n\\begin{rawhtml} </TABLE >\n\\end{rawhtml}";
00425                 }
00426         elsif ( $main::displayMode eq 'HTML_MathJax'
00427                       or $main::displayMode eq 'HTML_dpng'
00428                       or $main::displayMode eq 'HTML_tth'
00429                       or $main::displayMode eq 'HTML_jsMath'
00430                       or $main::displayMode eq 'HTML_asciimath'
00431                       or $main::displayMode eq 'HTML_LaTeXMathML'
00432                       or $main::displayMode eq 'HTML'
00433                       or $main::displayMode eq 'HTML_img') {
00434                 $out .= "</TABLE>\n";
00435                 }
00436         else {
00437                 $out = "Error: PGmatrixmacros: dm_end_matrix: Unknown displayMode: $main::displayMode.\n";
00438                 }
00439         $out;
00440 }
00441 
00442 # Make an image of a big delimiter for a matrix
00443 sub dm_image_delimeter {
00444         my $numRows = shift;
00445         my $char = shift;
00446         my ($out, $j);
00447 
00448         if($char eq ".") {return("");}
00449         if($char eq "d") { # special treatment for dashed lines
00450                 $out='\(\vbox to '.($numRows*1.7).'\baselineskip ';
00451                 $out .='{\cleaders\hbox{\vbox{\hrule width0pt height3pt depth0pt';
00452                 $out .='\hrule width0.3pt height6pt depth0pt';
00453                 $out .='\hrule width0pt height3pt depth0pt}}\vfil}\)';
00454                 return($out);
00455         }
00456 
00457         if($char eq "{") {$char = '\lbrace';}
00458         if($char eq "}") {$char = '\rbrace';}
00459         $out .= '\(\left.\vphantom{\begin{array}{c}';
00460         for($j=0;$j<=$numRows;$j++) { $out .= '\!\strut\\\\'; }
00461         $out .= '\end{array}}\right'.$char.'\)';
00462         return($out);
00463 }
00464 
00465 # Basically uses a table of special characters and simple
00466 # recipe to produce big delimeters a la tth mode
00467 sub dm_tth_delimeter {
00468         my $numRows = shift;
00469         my $char = shift;
00470 
00471         if($char eq ".") { return("");}
00472         my ($top, $mid, $bot, $extra);
00473         my ($j, $out);
00474 
00475         if($char eq "(") { ($top, $mid, $bot, $extra) = ('','','','');}
00476         elsif($char eq ")") { ($top, $mid, $bot, $extra) = ('','','','');}
00477         elsif($char eq "|") { ($top, $mid, $bot, $extra) = ('','','','');}
00478         elsif($char eq "[") { ($top, $mid, $bot, $extra) = ('','','','');}
00479         elsif($char eq "]") { ($top, $mid, $bot, $extra) = ('','','','');}
00480         elsif($char eq "{") { ($top, $mid, $bot, $extra) = ('','','','');}
00481         elsif($char eq "}") { ($top, $mid, $bot, $extra) = ('','','','');}
00482         else { warn "Unknown delimiter in dm_tth_delimeter";}
00483 
00484         # old version
00485 #       $out = '<td nowrap="nowrap" align="left"><font face="symbol">';
00486         $out = '<font face="symbol">';
00487         $out .= "$top<br />";
00488         for($j=1;$j<$numRows; $j++) {
00489                 $out .= "$mid<br />";
00490         }
00491         $out .= "$extra<br />";
00492         for($j=1;$j<$numRows; $j++) {
00493                 $out .= "$mid<br />";
00494         }
00495         $out .= "$bot</font></td>";
00496         return $out;
00497 }
00498 
00499 # Make a row for the matrix
00500 sub dm_mat_row {
00501         my $elements = shift;
00502         my $tmp = shift;
00503         my @align =  @{$tmp} ;
00504         my %opts = @_;
00505 
00506         if($elements eq 'hline') {
00507                 if ($main::displayMode eq 'TeX' or $opts{'force_tex'}) {
00508                         return '\hline ';
00509                 } else {
00510                         # Making a hline in a table
00511                         return '<tr><td colspan="'.scalar(@align).'"><hr></td></tr>';
00512                 }
00513         }
00514         
00515         my @elements = @{$elements};
00516         my $out = "";
00517         my ($brh, $erh) = ("",""); # Start and end raw html
00518         my $element;
00519         my $colcount=0;
00520         if($main::displayMode eq 'Latex2HTML') {
00521                 $brh = "\\begin{rawhtml}";
00522                 $erh = "\\end{rawhtml}";
00523         }
00524         if ($main::displayMode eq 'TeX' or $opts{'force_tex'}) {
00525                 while (@elements) {
00526             $colcount++;
00527             $out .= '\fbox{' if ($colcount == $opts{'box'}->[1] and $opts{'cnt'}  == $opts{'box'}->[0]);
00528                         $element= shift(@elements);
00529                         if(ref($element) eq 'Fraction') {
00530                                 $element=  $element->print_inline();
00531                         }
00532                         if($opts{'force_tex'}) {
00533                             $out .= "$element";
00534                         } else {
00535                             $out .= '\\mbox{'."$element".'}';
00536                         }
00537                         $out .= '}' if ($colcount == $opts{'box'}->[1] and $opts{'cnt'} == $opts{'box'}->[0]);
00538                         $out .= " &";
00539                 }
00540                 chop($out); # remove last &
00541                 $out .= "\\cr  \n";
00542                  # carriage returns must be added manually for tex
00543                 } elsif ( $main::displayMode eq 'HTML_MathJax'
00544                       or $main::displayMode eq 'HTML_dpng'
00545                       or $main::displayMode eq 'HTML_tth'
00546                       or $main::displayMode eq 'HTML_jsMath'
00547                       or $main::displayMode eq 'HTML_asciimath'
00548                       or $main::displayMode eq 'HTML_LaTeXMathML'
00549                       or $main::displayMode eq 'HTML'
00550                       or $main::displayMode eq 'HTML_img') {
00551                         if(not $opts{'isfirst'}) {                $out .=  "$brh\n<TR>\n$erh";}
00552                 while (@elements) {
00553                         my $myalign;
00554                         $myalign = shift @align;
00555                         if($myalign eq "|" or $myalign eq "d") {
00556                                 if($opts{'isfirst'} && $main::displayMode ne 'HTML_tth') {
00557                                         $out .= $brh.'<td rowspan="'.$opts{'isfirst'}.'">'.$erh;
00558                                         $out .= dm_image_delimeter($opts{'isfirst'}-1, $myalign);
00559                                 } elsif($main::displayMode eq 'HTML_tth') {
00560                                         if($myalign eq "d") { # dashed line in tth mode
00561                                                 $out .= '<td> | </td>';
00562                                         } elsif($opts{'isfirst'}) { # solid line in tth mode
00563                                                 $out .= '<td rowspan="'.$opts{'isfirst'}.'"<table border="0"><tr>';
00564                                                 $out .= dm_tth_delimeter($opts{'isfirst'}-1, "|");
00565                                                 $out .= '</td></tr></table>';
00566                                         }
00567                                 }
00568                         } else {
00569                                 if($myalign eq "c") { $myalign = "center";}
00570                                 if($myalign eq "l") { $myalign = "left";}
00571                                 if($myalign eq "r") { $myalign = "right";}
00572                 $colcount++;
00573                 $out .= '\fbox{' if ($colcount == $opts{'box'}->[1] and $opts{'cnt'} == $opts{'box'}->[0]);
00574                                 $element= shift(@elements);
00575                                 if (ref($element) eq 'Fraction') {
00576                                         $element=  $element->print_inline();
00577                                 #}elsif( $element =~ /^([+-]?)(?=\d|\.\d)\d*(\.\d*)?([Ee]([+-]?\d+))?$/ and $element != sprintf($opts{'num_format'},$element) and $element - sprintf($opts{'num_format'},$element) < $main::functZeroLevelTolDefault){
00578                 #   $element = sprintf($opts{'num_format'},$element);
00579                 #   $element = 0 if abs($element) < $main::functZeroLevelTolDefault;
00580                 }
00581                                 $out .= "$brh<TD nowrap=\"nowrap\" align=\"$myalign\">$erh";
00582                                 $out .= '<table border="1"><tr><td>' if ($colcount == $opts{'box'}->[1] and $opts{'cnt'} == $opts{'box'}->[0]);
00583                                 $out .= $element;
00584                                 $out .= '</td></tr></table>' if ($colcount == $opts{'box'}->[1] and $opts{'cnt'} == $opts{'box'}->[0]);
00585                 $out .= "$brh</TD>$erh";
00586                         }
00587                 }
00588                         if(not $opts{'isfirst'}) {$out .="$brh</TR>$erh\n";}
00589         }
00590         else {
00591                 $out = "Error: dm_mat_row: Unknown displayMode: $main::displayMode.\n";
00592                 }
00593         $out;
00594 }
00595 
00596 =head4  mbox
00597 
00598                 Usage        \{ mbox(thing1, thing2, thing3) \}
00599           \{ mbox([thing1, thing2, thing3], valign=>'top') \}
00600 
00601     mbox takes a list of constructs, such as strings, or outputs of
00602           display_matrix, and puts them together on a line.  Without mbox, the
00603           output of display_matrix would always start a new line.
00604 
00605           The inputs can be just listed, or given as a reference to an array.
00606           With the latter, optional arguments can be given.
00607 
00608           Optional arguments are allowbreaks=>'yes' to allow line breaks in TeX
00609           output; and valign which sets vertical alignment on web page output.
00610 
00611 =cut
00612         
00613 sub mbox {
00614         my $inList = shift;
00615         my %opts;
00616         if(ref($inList) eq 'ARRAY') {
00617                 %opts = @_;
00618         } else {
00619                 %opts = ();
00620                 $inList = [$inList, @_];
00621         }
00622 
00623         set_default_options(\%opts,
00624             '_filter_name' => 'mbox',
00625             'valign' => 'middle',
00626             'allowbreaks' => 'no',
00627             'allow_unknown_options'=> 0
00628         );
00629         if(! $opts{'allowbreaks'}) { $opts{'allowbreaks'}='no';}
00630         my $out = "";
00631         my $j;
00632         my ($brh, $erh) = ("",""); # Start and end raw html if needed
00633         if($main::displayMode eq 'Latex2HTML') {
00634                 $brh = "\\begin{rawhtml}";
00635                 $erh = "\\end{rawhtml}";
00636         }
00637         my @hlist = @{$inList};
00638         if($main::displayMode eq 'TeX') {
00639                 if($opts{allowbreaks} ne 'no') {$out .= '\mbox{';}
00640                 for $j (@hlist) { $out .= $j;}
00641                 if($opts{allowbreaks} ne 'no') {$out .= '}';}
00642         } else {
00643                 $out .= qq!$brh<table><tr valign="$opts{'valign'}">$erh!;
00644                 for $j (@hlist) {
00645                         $out .= qq!$brh<td align="center" nowrap="nowrap">$erh$j$brh</td>$erh!;
00646                 }
00647                 $out .= "$brh</table>$erh";
00648         }
00649         return $out;
00650 }
00651                 
00652 
00653 =head4   ra_flatten_matrix
00654 
00655                 Usage:   ra_flatten_matrix($A)
00656                 
00657                         where $A is a matrix object
00658                         The output is a reference to an array.  The matrix is placed in the array by iterating
00659                         over  columns on the inside
00660                         loop, then over the rows. (e.g right to left and then down, as one reads text)
00661 
00662 
00663 =cut
00664 
00665 
00666 sub ra_flatten_matrix{
00667         my $matrix = shift;
00668         warn "The argument must be a matrix object" unless ref($matrix) =~ /Matrix/;
00669         my @array = ();
00670         my ($rows, $cols ) = $matrix->dim();
00671         foreach my $i (1..$rows) {
00672                 foreach my $j (1..$cols) {
00673                         push(@array, $matrix->element($i,$j)  );
00674                 }
00675         }
00676         \@array;
00677 }
00678 
00679 # This subroutine is probably obsolete and not generally useful.  It was patterned after the APL
00680 # constructs for multiplying matrices. It might come in handy for non-standard multiplication of 
00681 # of matrices (e.g. mod 2) for indice matrices.
00682 sub apl_matrix_mult{
00683         my $ra_a= shift;
00684         my $ra_b= shift;
00685         my %options = @_;
00686         my $rf_op_times= sub {$_[0] *$_[1]};
00687         my $rf_op_plus = sub {my $sum = 0; my @in = @_; while(@in){ $sum = $sum + shift(@in) } $sum; };
00688         $rf_op_times = $options{'times'} if defined($options{'times'}) and ref($options{'times'}) eq 'CODE';
00689         $rf_op_plus = $options{'plus'} if defined($options{'plus'}) and ref($options{'plus'}) eq 'CODE';
00690         my $rows = @$ra_a;
00691         my $cols = @{$ra_b->[0]};
00692         my $k_size = @$ra_b;
00693         my $out ;
00694         my ($i, $j, $k);
00695         for($i=0;$i<$rows;$i++) {
00696                 for($j=0;$j<$cols;$j++) {
00697                     my @r = ();
00698                     for($k=0;$k<$k_size;$k++) {
00699                             $r[$k] =  &$rf_op_times($ra_a->[$i]->[$k] , $ra_b->[$k]->[$j]);
00700                     }
00701                         $out->[$i]->[$j] = &$rf_op_plus( @r );
00702                 }
00703         }
00704         $out;
00705 }
00706 
00707 sub matrix_mult {
00708         apl_matrix_mult($_[0], $_[1]);
00709 }
00710 
00711 sub make_matrix{
00712         my $function = shift;
00713         my $rows = shift;
00714         my $cols = shift;
00715         my ($i, $j, $k);
00716         my $ra_out;
00717         for($i=0;$i<$rows;$i++) {
00718                 for($j=0;$j<$cols;$j++) {
00719                         $ra_out->[$i]->[$j] = &$function($i,$j);
00720                 }
00721         }
00722         $ra_out;
00723 }
